Copyrights/Licenses

　Please see license.txt included with the SDK.
　Below is a FAQ regarding copyrights and licenses, addressing questions many people likely have.
　The principles are exactly as written in license.txt, so please be sure to read license.txt.
　If there is any discrepancy between what is written here and what is written in license.txt, the contents of license.txt take precedence.

Do I have to pay money to the author of Kirikiri?
　That is not necessary.
I want to use it for commercial purposes (including shareware)...
　You can use it for commercial purposes.
　No license fees are required for use, even for commercial purposes. You can use it for free.
I want to mention your name in my work...
　You do not specifically need to state in your documentation, etc., that you used Kirikiri.
　Of course, you are welcome to write it if you like (^^;
　Unless specifically noted otherwise, you cannot remove the license display shown by the -about option.
　If you include the license display in documentation, etc., in accordance with the Modified BSD License, it is possible to remove the license display shown by -about.
Do I have to notify the author of Kirikiri when my work is completed?
　There is no obligation to notify us that you used Kirikiri. There is no obligation to notify even in commercial cases.
　However, if you drop us a line, we will surely be happy, yes.
I want to reuse the Kirikiri source code...
　Kirikiri Z is under the Modified BSD License. You can reuse the source code in accordance with the Modified BSD License.

Acknowledgements

　Kirikiri 2 and Kirikiri Z are made possible by the cooperation of many people. I would like to thank everyone for their kindness.
　Especially regarding Kirikiri/KAG, I received much advice from Ensign PIA. Thank you.

　Kirikiri Z was developed through crowdfunding, supported financially by many people.
　The supporters (in no particular order, titles omitted) are: W.Dee, casper, MCF Co., Ltd., Biscrat, 青猫, nagai, ルー, Masayuki Takagiwa, 永劫, Yunyun Tantei, りょうご (今は無きあの星), AZ-UME, Akito Kyo, Katsumasa Tsuneyoshi, Jun Koike, miahmie, Circle Baku, アザナシ, Hasshii, Tanaka Seisakusho, Waffle, Wamsoft, TYPE-MOON, and M2 Co., Ltd.

　The Win32Ole plugin and various other plugins were provided by Mr. Go Watanabe. Thank you.

　Photoshop-compatible blend functions were provided by Mr. Kenjo. Thank you.

　Gamepad support code was provided by Mr. Kiyobee. Thank you.

　KAGParser class documentation and KAG extensions were provided by Mr. Kouhei Yanagita. Thank you.

　The Kirikiri icons are by Mr. MIK. Thank you.

　Various functions regarding movie playback, such as layer-based movie playback, incorporate the "Movie Extension" provided by Mr. Takenori Imoto. Thank you.
http://www.kaede-software.com/

　The blur implementation is based on code provided by Mr. yun. Thank you.

　Pad-related functional enhancement patches and implementations such as String.reverse() were received from Mr. mey. Thank you.

　Below is a list of programming libraries/support software used by Kirikiri (in no particular order, titles omitted). I thank those who have made these useful libraries available.
